clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety of the HIV-1 Vaccine MVA-B in Chronic HIV-1 Infected Patients Successfully Treated With HAART
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety of the HIV-1 Vaccine MVA-B in Chronic HIV-1 Infected Patients Successfully Treated With HAART

brief_summary.textblock: 30 treated chronic HIV-1 infected patients with CD4+ cell counts above 450 cells/ mm3 will be randomized 1:2 to receive placebo (n=10) or vaccine (n=20) at week 0, 4 and 16 and will be observed at the Investigation Unit of the study site for one hour following vaccination. At week 24 they will stop their HAART until the end of the study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Grade 3 or above local adverse event (pain, cutaneous reactions including induration) Grade 3 or above systemic adverse event (temperature, chills, headache, nausea, vomiting, malaise, and myalgia) Grade 3 or above other clinical or laboratory adverse event confirmed at examination or on repeat testing respectively Any event attributable to vaccine leading to discontinuation of the immunisation regimen

primary_outcome.time_frame: After each inmunisation and at weeks 6-8 and 18-20
primary_outcome.description: Cellular responses - CD8/CD4+ T cell responses (ELISPOT)

secondary_outcome.description: After HAART interruption compared between both arms and with baseline viral load before any medication in each arm
binding titration to the construct MVAB binding titration to and neutralisation of vaccinia

arm_group.description: Modified Pox virus, strain MVA clade -B (expressing HIV-1 Bx08gp120 and IIIB gagpolnef) (MVA HIV-B)

intervention.description: Modified Pox virus, strain MVA clade -B (expressing HIV-1 Bx08gp120 and IIIB gagpolnef) -~ 1 x 10e8 pfu/ml 3 immunisations at week 0, 4 and 16
